sentences: Jan Johansson (16 September 1931 – 9 November 1968) was a Swedish jazz pianist.

His album Jazz på svenska (Jazz in Swedish) is the best selling jazz release ever in Sweden; it has sold over a quarter of a million copies and has been streamed more than 10 million times on Spotify.
Johansson was a native of Söderhamn, in the Hälsingland province of Sweden.
He abandoned his studies to play jazz full-time, and worked with many American jazz musicians, becoming the first European to be invited to join the Jazz at the Philharmonic package.
With lyrics by character/series creator Astrid Lindgren and sung by the series' young star Inger Nilsson, it would also be one of Johansson's last works.
In November 1968, Jan Johansson died in a car crash on his way to a concert in a church in Jönköping, Sweden.
